Description: A unique ID for the sampling event, preferably as "<cruiseID>#<station/event number>". For example: 64PE438#21. Very important because it is used to match stations metadata to species observations. No empty (i.e. NA) cells should occur.

The taxonomic name assigned to the reported species/taxon name in the original species CSV files by checking against the accepted names in the WoRMS database. No empty (i.e. NA) cells should occur, because all taxa that could not be matched against WoRMS are discarded from the database.
The file name of the original input CSV file from which the species data is imported. No empty (i.e. NA) cells should occur.

The rank of the valid_name as assigned by checking against the WoRMS database. Possible ranks of the valid_name is: species, genus, family, order, class, phylum. No empty (i.e. NA) cells should occur.
The phylum that belongs to the taxon under valid_name. Will only be NA if the valid_name has a rank higher than phylum (like kingdom) which is very unlikely.
The class that belongs to the taxon under valid_name. Will only be NA if the valid_name has a rank higher than class.
The order that belongs to the taxon under valid_name. Will only be NA if the valid_name has a rank higher than order.
The family that belongs to the taxon under valid_name. Will only be NA if the valid_name has a rank higher than family.
The genus that belongs to the taxon under valid_name. Will only be NA if the valid_name has a rank higher than genus.

If the valid_name was obtained from WoRMS using an algorithm that searches for fuzzy matches (i.e. allows misspellings and phonetic spellings) isFuzzy is TRUE. If the match was exact is Fuzzy will be FALSE.

If the density value is based on incomplete data, this value is TRUE, otherwise FALSE. An example of incomplete count data: Station 1, species A = 2 of 4 mm, Species A = 3 of 3 mm, Species A = unknown count of 1 mm, total count of species A at Station 1 = 5 but incomplete i.e. underestimation).

If the biomass value is based on incomplete data, this value is TRUE, otherwise FALSE. An example of incomplete biomass data: Station 1, species A = 1 of 5 gram, Species A = 1 of 6 gram, Species A = 1 of unknown weight, total weight of species A at Station 1 = 11 gram but incomplete i.e. underestimation).

The original column name where the biomass value was taken from. AFDW_sum = the reported biomass was measured in the lab (high confidence). AFDW_from_WW_sum = the reported biomass was converted from measured wet weight using a conversion factor in the bioconversion.csv file (medium confidence). AFDW_calc_sum = the reported biomass obtain using a regression formula from the bioconversion.csv file (low confidence).
Name of the research vessel. Often used: RV Pelagia. Optional field, so may be NA.
Cruise ID when the sampling occurred, for example 64PE438. If the cruise also had a name it can optionally be provided in the attribute Cruise_name. No empty (NA) fields should occur.
Generic name of the research cruise. DO NOT CONFUSE with CruiseID. Optional, so may contain empty (NA) fields.
Generic name of the station where the sample is taken, can be used to later link back to for example box core samples. DO NOT CONFUSE with StationID. Optional, so may contain empty (NA) fields.
The date when the sampling event took place in the format "DD/MM/YYYY". For example: 12/01/1994. Should be based on the time in UTC+0. Should not contain empty (NA) fields.
Time in UTC+0 when the dredge touched bottom or when the sampling started. Format: HH:MM:SS. If only one moment in time is recorded, use this column; leave out Time_stop or set to NA.
Time in UTC+0 when the dredge was heaved from the bottom or when sampling stopped. Format: HH:MM:SS.
The depth in cm of the exised strip of sediment by the blade.
The width in cm of the exised strip of sediment by the blade.

For each sampling track it should be noted if the catch can be used fully quantitatively (isQuantitative = 1) or not (isQuantitative = 0). For example, if there are doubts about if the catch correctly represents the full area sampled track but the data might still be useful to analyze the abundance of species relative to each other, the data can be included while setting the isQuantitative to 0.

Sometimes a cruise or sampling station has a specific focus on a taxonomic group or a certain taxonomic group is explicitally excluded. For every track specify: If the full catch was IDed and processed (so no focus or exclusions) Station_objective = Complete. If some groups were specifically excluded or focussed on i.e. not the full catch was processed, Station_objective = Incomplete. In this case the excluded taxonomic groups should be noted in the column "Excluded" seperated by a ";" and focussed on taxonomic groups should be noted in the column "Focus" seperated by a ";".

If Station_objective = Incomplete and certain groups were not IDed and processed, this column should specify which taxa were excluded, seperated by ";". For example: Polychaeta;Callianassa. With exclusion we mean that there is no informtion at all noted about these taxa. For example, if a taxon was not counted but it was bulk measured the information is still usefull for presence/absence and biomass plots. Therefore, it should not be considered 'excluded'. Set to NA if there were no excluded taxa.

If Station_objective = Incomplete and some groups were specifically focussed on, this column should be filled with the names of taxonomic groups which were the focus of this specific sampling station, seperated by ";". For example: Polychaeta;Callianassa.  Set to NA for all entries were no species were specifically focussed on.

Unit: Predefined: BB, BC, CB, CZ, DB, DH, FF, FG, OF, OG, WM
Description: Predefined general region where the sample is taken. If the station was not in these predefined regions, insert NA. BB = Brown Bank, BC = Botney Cut, CB = Cleaver Bank, CZ = Coastal Zone, DB = Dogger Bank, DH = Devil's Hole, FF = Frysian Front, FG = Fladen Grounds, OF = Offshore, OG = Oyster Grounds, WM = wind mill area.
The average speed at which the TripleD was towed in knots (one nautical mile per hour).
Any comments regarding the sampling station.
Latitude in decimal degrees of the midpoint of the dredge track in WGS84.

The original column name where the latitude was taken from. Lat_DD_midpt = the midpoint latitude reported in the input CSV file. Lat_DD_calc = the midpoint latitude calculated from start and stop coordinates reported in the input CSV file.
Longitude in decimal degrees of the midpoint of the dredge track in WGS84.

The original column name where the longitude was taken from. Lon_DD_midpt = the midpoint longitude reported in the input CSV file. Lon_DD_calc = the midpoint longitude calculated from start and stop coordinates reported in the input CSV file.
Water depth in meters at the sampling track.

The original column name where the water depth was taken from. Water_depth_m_cruise = the water depth as reported in the input CSV files. Water_depth_m_Bathy = the water depth as taken from bathymetry (default NOAA bathymetry with a resolution of 1 minute) using the track midpoints. Water_depth_m_Bathy2 = the water depth as taken from bathymetry (default NOAA bathymetry with a resolution of 1 minute) using the track midpoints calculated with track start and stop coordinates.
The length of the TripleD dredge track at the sampling station in meters.

The original column name where the track length was taken from. Track_length_m_cruise = the track length as reported in the input CSV files. Track_dist_m_Odometer = the track length calculated from reported odometer ticks. Track_dist_m_GPS = the track length calculated from start and stop coordinates.

A measure for the general direction of the dredged track. Is reported as an angle in respect to the north (0):  -0 to -180 is the angle westward/left from the north, and +0 to +180 is the angle eastwards/right from the north.

The original column name where the bearing was taken from. Bearing = the bearing as provided by the creator of the original dataset. Bearing_calc = bearing calculated with the geosphere package based on start and stop coordinates.
The total area sampled by the TripleD in square meters, i.e. the track length times the blade width. No empty cells (i.e. NA) should occur.
The total volume sampled by the TripleD in cubic meters, i.e. the track length times the blade width times the blade width. No empty cells (i.e. NA) should occur.

The number of specimens of the taxon under valid_name per squared meter at the corresponding sampling station. This value represents 100% of the catch (so the value is corrected for any reported fraction in the original CSV files) and is corrected for sample size of the track. All NA values are converted to 0 (incomplete_count will be TRUE), so no NA values should occur.

The number of specimens of the taxon under valid_name per cubic meter at the corresponding sampling station. This value represents 100% of the catch (so the value is corrected for any reported fraction in the original CSV files) and is corrected for sample size of the track. All NA values are converted to 0 (incomplete_count will be TRUE), so no NA values should occur.

Unit: Grams ash-free dry weight per squared meter
Description: Grams of ash-free dry weight of the taxon under valid_name per squared meter at the corresponding sampling station. This value represents 100% of the catch (so the value is corrected for any reported fraction in the original CSV files) and is corrected for sample size of the track. All NA values are converted to 0 (incomplete_biomass will be TRUE), so no NA values should occur.

Unit: Grams ash-free dry weight per cubic meter
Description: Grams of ash-free dry weight of the taxon under valid_name per cubic meter at the corresponding sampling station. This value represents 100% of the catch (so the value is corrected for any reported fraction in the original CSV files) and is corrected for sample size of the track. All NA values are converted to 0 (incomplete_biomass will be TRUE), so no NA values should occur.
